intro: Lepechinia hastata subsp. hastata, commonly known as the Sierra grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in arid environments.
